author: .vbuterin
content: Btw one thing we should discuss at some point is, exactly how much of this should be standardized

author: .vbuterin
content: There are going to be different clients that take different tradeoffs

author: .vbuterin
content: eg. I've advocated the N-server model

author: .vbuterin
content: Because it gives serious improvements over the status quo of "just trusting infura" but it's still simple enough that people are going to be willing to adopt it

author: .vbuterin
content: We don't want to see amazing pure solutions that nobody actually uses because figuring the p2p out is too complicated or whatever

author: .vbuterin
content: But then if you *do* have a node....

author: .vbuterin
content: Another benefit of the N-server model is that if you lean on the 1-of-N honesty assumption harder, you get a "poor man's TheGraph"

author: .vbuterin
content: Basically a way to answer web3 log queries ("give me all logs between block X and block Y that satisfy topic T")

author: .vbuterin
content: Ask N servers, get the responses, verify their merkle proofs, union them, and stop trusting any server that misses a log in their response
